articles.title: DPRK Premier Learns about Renovation Project at Kim Hyong Jik University of Education
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Learns about Renovation Project at Kim Hyong Jik University of Education
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Premier Choe Yong Rim, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Thursday acquainted himself with the renovation and repair project at its final phase at Kim Hyong Jik University of Education.
					 The appearance of the university underwent a radical change thanks to the devoted efforts of the soldier-builders who carried out the huge project in the spirit of "at one go" true to the noble intention of general secretary Kim Jong Il and the order of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He went round the mosaic depicting the images of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in the campus, new school buildings and other places of the university.
					
					 A consultative meeting held there discussed issues of ensuring formative art in architecture by learning from the militant spirit and creative spirit of soldier-builders and completing the installing of equipment to be used for education and other work qualitatively.
					
					 It took measures to facelift the university, a pedigree establishment for training teachers, associated with the leadership provided by the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu, and called on the related units to ensure a satisfactory supply of materials for the project.

articles.title: DPRK Foreign Minister Meets New Ambassadors of Mongolia, Brazil
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Minister Meets New Ambassadors of Mongolia, Brazil
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, Thursday separately met and had talks with Manibadrakh Ganbold, new Mongolian ambassador, and Roberto Colin, new Brazilian ambassador to the DPRK who paid courtesy calls on him.

articles.title: Kim Ki Nam Meets Vietnamese Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Ki Nam Meets Vietnamese Delegation 
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a talk with the visiting delegation of the Vietnamese paper Nhan Dan headed by Editor-in-Chief Thuan Huu at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday. 
					 The head of the delegation said that the delegation's visit to the DPRK offered it an opportunity to know better about the achievements made by the Korean people in socialist construction and in the struggle for national reunification under the steersmanship of President Kim Il Sung, general secretary Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The Korean people are a heroic people who do not yield to any move to stifle them by foreign forces, he added. 
					
					 He expressed the will to contribute to boosting the exchange and cooperation between the party newspapers of the two countries.

articles.title: Gift from Vietnamese Newspaper
articles.content:
Gift from Vietnamese Newspaper
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un on Thursday received a gift from the Vietnamese paper Nhan Dan.
					 The gift was handed over from Thuan Huu, editor-in-chief of the paper, to Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Greetings to Jordanian King
articles.content:
Greetings to Jordanian King
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greeting to King Abdullahâ…¡on the 66th anniversary of Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan.
					 Kim in the message wished the king good heath and well-being and friendly Jordan steady progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Marks Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Letter on Chongryon
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Marks Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Letter on Chongryon
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Thursday dedicates a by-lined article to the 17th anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il's letter "On Developing the Movement of Koreans in Japan onto a New Higher Stage".
					 The letter comprehensively deals with the immortal exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung in the history of the movement of Koreans in Japan. It also expounds the basic orientation for the work of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and key tasks to be always adhered to in the patriotic activity of Chongryon.
					
					 For this reason, the letter serves as a powerful ideo-theoretical weapon for the patriotic cause of Chongryon both in name and reality. It helped open a turning phase of the movement of Koreans in Japan and firmly guaranteed its bright future, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The publication of the letter was a historic event as it encouraged officials in Chongryon and Koreans in Japan to take part in the struggle for developing the movement of Koreans in Japan and brought about a signal turn in the Juche-oriented movement of overseas Koreans.
					
					 Officials in Chongryon and Koreans in Japan have spurred the movement of Koreans in Japan full of faith, true to the line and policy set forth by Kim Jong Il in the letter. The truth and vitality of the line and policy specified in the historic letter were fully demonstrated at home and abroad in those days.
					
					 The patriotic line and nature of Chongryon were invariably defended and its core stronghold was consolidated than ever before despite the harsh environment and situation of uninterrupted rackets against the DPRK and Chongryon. The national rights of compatriots have been constantly boosted through different mass movements including the movement to invite Koreans to come to the fold of Chongryon.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams Lee Myung Bak's Invective against DPRK
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams Lee Myung Bak's Invective against DPRK 
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak during his recent foreign trip called for "effective counteraction" and "close cooperation", bringing to discussion "the north's nuclear test and further provocations".
					 Lee's riff-raffs in Ministries of Foreign Affairs and Trade and Unification as well as Chongwadae, following the suit, said they would "not tolerate the north's further provocations as they are anticipated" when talking with their foreign counterparts.
					
					 Minju Joson Thursday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 It is like a thief crying "Stop the thief!" for the group of traitors to cite "further provocations" by the DPRK.
					
					 The group seems to love to talk about "further provocations", but it reminds one of a proverb "The thief is afraid of his own shadow".
					
					 It is tragicomic for the traitor to drum up support from outside as he is rejected by his clans after being sentenced to death by the people.
					
					 This bears a resemblance to a rat that gnaws pillars of a house.
					
					 As proved by the facts, the north and the south can never mend their fences and achieve the nation's desire of reunification, unless they make a clean sweep of the group of traitors that made ceaseless provocations against the fellow countrymen to freeze the inter-Korean relations and pushed the situation of the Korean Peninsula to the brink of war.
					
					 It is quite natural for the army and people of the DPRK to turn out in a just struggle for revenging on the group of rat-like Lee Myung Bak.
					
					 No matter how hard the group works to incorporate others in its confrontation with fellow countrymen, it can not prolong its remaining days.

articles.title: Minju Joson Discloses Intentions of Park Geun Hye behind Call for "Distinction" from Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Minju Joson Discloses Intentions of Park Geun Hye behind Call for "Distinction" from Lee Myung Bak
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Recently, the group of "Saenuri Party" of Park Geun Hye speaks loudly about "distinction" from Lee Myung Bak, says Minju Joson Thursday in a bylined commentary, terming it an absurd sleight of hand to win the public mindset.
					 The "Saenuri Party" has neither face nor justification to talk about "distinction" from Lee Myung Bak, the commentary notes, citing facts to prove that traitor Lee perpetrated lots of crimes backed by "Saenuri Party" over a little more than four years since he took office.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 Park opposed the draft amendment to Sejong City raised by Lee in return for the cold shoulder he gave her who agreed with other parties to build Sejong City when she was working as chief of the "Grand National Party". This was aimed to improve her public image by taking advantage of people's opposition to the draft amendment.
					
					 Disclosing the purpose of Park in instigating the confidants of the "Saenuri Party" to loudly talk about "distinction" from Lee, the commentary continues:
					
					 Traitor Lee is now tight-cornered. Opposition parties and public organizations are calling Lee and Park just the same devils, while spreading the "theory of punishing Lee Myung Bak-Park Geun Hye" instead of the "theory of punishing regime". It is clear as noonday that the situation will turn unfavorable for the "Saenuri Party" of Park in the "presidential" election in December if it keeps patronizing Lee. This is the reason that Park is emphasizing "distinction" from Lee.
					
					 Lee and Park would only face stern punishment by the nation as they committed thrice-cursed crimes against the nation aligned with each other, concludes the commentary.

articles.title: Iranian Film Week Opens in DPRK
articles.content:
Iranian Film Week Opens in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Iranian film week was opened with due ceremony at Taedongmun Cinema Thursday to mark the 23rd anniversary of the meeting between President Kim Il Sung and Leader of the Islamic Revolution of Iran Seyed Ali Khamenei.
					 Present at the ceremony were Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who doubles as vice-chairman of the DPRK-Iran Friendship Association, officials concerned, working people in Pyongyang and Ambassador Morteza Moradian and staff members of the Iranian embassy here.
					
					 Present there on invitation were diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 The speakers said that the meeting between Kim Il Sung and Seyed Ali Khamenei provided a foundation for the development of bilateral relations of friendship.
					
					 They expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow stronger.
					
					 The participants watched an Iranian feature film.

articles.title: Afforestation Progresses Apace in DPRK
articles.content:
Afforestation Progresses Apace in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- A brisk afforestation is under way in the DPRK.
					 The officials and working people in North Hamgyong Province planted 834,000 trees more than its plan for this year. The province set this year's plan for tree planting in a big way and let tree nurseries of the cities and counties give priority to the supply of saplings.
					
					 Orang, Myongchon and Kyonghung counties applied quality composts to tree nurseries and effectively conducted weeding, manuring and cultivation after sowing seeds in levees and ridges in good combination, thereby raising many saplings this year, too.
					
					 Hoeryong City, Musan County and other cities and counties spruced up tree nurseries to suit their specific conditions and put the sapling production on a scientific, industrial and intensive basis.
					
					 Yonsa and Onsong counties respectively created at least 700 hectares of Changsong larches while Chongjin City and Kyongwon and Hwadae counties planted needle-leaf trees and broadleaf trees such as poplar, three-leaf pines and acacias in appropriate combination.
					
					 Kim Chaek City and Puryong County planted trees in a qualitative manner and carried out manuring and cultivation in a tenacious way, remarkably increasing the rate of rooting.
					
					 The province is also pushing forward the creation of timber forests, groves of oil-producing trees, wild fruit forests and forests for raw materials for pulp and paper.

articles.title: Specific Remedy for Thrombosis Manufactured in DPRK
articles.content:
Specific Remedy for Thrombosis Manufactured in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Drawing visitors' deep interest at the recent 15th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair was the Jiryong capsule, a specific remedy for thrombosis, presented by the New Technology Exchange Company of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 This capsule is a new thrombolytic preparation. The chief ingredient is Lumbrokinase, thrombolytic enzyme, separated from earthworm that has been used as a source of Koryo medicine for thousands of years. 
					
					 Kim Jong Guk, section chief of the Company, told KCNA:
					
					 This remedy has overcome the defects of previous thrombolytic preparations and is efficacious scores of times higher.
					
					 The clinical trials, conducted at several leading hospitals in recent five years, showed that its efficiency was more than 94 percent.
					
					 Ingredients of the remedy are earthworm (thrombolytic activity 12,000 IU/cap), sodium alginate, mint plant and etc. 
					
					 After absorption by digestion organs into blood vessel, the capsule is absorbed into blood clot and dissolves it directly as plasmin does.
					
					It also has such functions as anti-platelet, anti-coagulation and anti-oxidation, so it is very ideal for preventing and curing thrombosis.
					
					 The capsule treats and prevents all of thrombus-related diseases, such as cerebral thrombosis, myocardial infarction, anginose, hepatofibrosis, nephrocirrhosis and spontaneous gangrene and their prodromal symptoms and arteriosclerosis.
					
					 In case of diabetes by pancreatic infarction, its administration is the most active cause treatment.
					
					 The Jiryong capsule is now popular on Asian and European markets.

articles.title: International Youth Travel Company in DPRK
articles.content:
International Youth Travel Company in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The International Youth Travel Company, founded in March Juche 74 (1985), is located in Phyongchon District, Pyongyang.
					 The company has the International Youth Exchange Agency under it, which works to organize local tourism and camping for foreigners.
					
					The tourist arrivals include mainly those from China, Germany, Austria and UK.
					
					 Staffed with qualified tourism experts, the agency renders creditable services to tourists.
					
					 The company joined the International Youth Tourist Exchange Organization in 1986.
					
					 Pak Ung San, president of the company, told KCNA that the company is carefully working out camping and touring schedules in step with the world's tendency of tourism development so that tourists may pend enjoyable days during their stay in the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK Has Many Tourist Destinations: Foreign Tourists
articles.content:
DPRK Has Many Tourist Destinations: Foreign Tourists
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Organized by the Lupine Travel Agency in the United Kingdom, a group of tourists from various countries visited the Democratic People's Republic of Korea to tour the capital city of Pyongyang, Kaesong and Mt. Myohyang.
					 The tourists had a sightseeing of monumental edifices, historical relics and had golf game for three days.
					
					 Alexander Peake, a British businessman, told KCNA about his impressions on the visit to the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace:
					
					"I get to know a lot, touring various places of Pyongyang. The city is very beautiful and the people are very friendly.
					
					 It is different from what I heard in England. I am very impressive with witnessing schoolchildren's skillful talents at Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace. The Palace is very great.
					
					 In England, there is no palace for schoolchildren."
					
					 Stephens Kerry Glan, a New Zealand businessman, said:
					
					 "The golf course is fantastic.
					
					 I have great experience to play golf in Pyongyang and I am very glad to build friendship with people from various countries. I am very impressed with the DPRK people's kindliness.

articles.title: New Species of Catfish Inhabited in Central Zoo
articles.content:
New Species of Catfish Inhabited in Central Zoo
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Upside-down catfish (Synodontis nigriventris) was inhabited in the aquarium of the Central Zoo in Pyongyang some days ago, the first of its species in the aquarium.
					 Known as one of rare species, the 7 to 15 centimeter-long fish has six barbells. Its body is covered with black and light-color brindles. It lives near rocks under still water of rivers and lakes, hatching out on rocks.
					
					 Its fries move like other fishes but only the grown-ups backstroke. When not moving, its jowl leans downward.

articles.title: Land Management Makes Brisk Headway
articles.content:
Land Management Makes Brisk Headway 
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Officials and other working people in South Hamgyong Province have registered many successes in improving rivers and streams and technically reinforcing roads as part of the campaign for land management.
					 A project was dynamically pushed forward to lead the course of rivers and streams straight and reinforce dykes, etc.
					
					 The officials and other working people in Pukchong County built several cement structures for the protection of the banks of the rivers and streams in the county and planted thousands of fast-growing trees along the banks.
					
					 Those in Hamhung city completed the project for improving both banks of River Songchon flowing through the city.
					
					 Those in Yonggwang and Sinhung counties and several other cities and counties improved the rivers and streams so that water may smoothly flow even in case of torrential rains and planted many trees to protect them from flooding.
					
					 The projects for building roads and technically reinforcing them are also making brisk headway.
					
					 Builders of Majon road have carried out the planned project at more than 85 pct by removing hundreds of thousands of cubic meters of earth and stepping up stonework and the work to lay the roadbed. 
					
					 Those in Hongwon and Riwon counties and Tanchon City and others are accelerating the projects for technically improving the roads and planted over 10 000 trees of good species such as acacia and Pyongyang maple along either side of the roads.
					
					 The projects for reinforcing dozens of bridges are also progressing apace.
					
					 Several units including Puraesan Cement Factory are ensuring a timely supply of materials for the projects.

articles.title: Swedish Delegation Tours Pyongyang
articles.content:
Swedish Delegation Tours Pyongyang 
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Kent Harstedt, lawmaker from Social Democratic Party of Sweden, and his party toured the Tower of the Juche Idea.
					 Being briefed on the grand monument conveying the ideological and theoretical achievements made by President Kim Il Sung, the guests went round the tower and group sculptures.
					
					 They enjoyed the bird's-eye view of Pyongyang from the top of the tower.
					
					 They also visited the e-library of Kim Il Sung University, Hana Music Information Center, etc.

articles.title: Swedish Lawmaker Leaves
articles.content:
Swedish Lawmaker Leaves
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Kent Harstedt, lawmaker from the Social Democratic Party of Sweden, left here on Thursday.

articles.title: Tower of Juche Idea, Grand Edifice
articles.content:
Tower of Juche Idea, Grand Edifice
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Vietnamese paper Nhan Dan headed by Thuan Huu, editor-in-chief of the paper, visited the Tower of the Juche Idea.
					 The tower conveying the idea of President Kim Il Sung is a grand edifice, the editor-in-chief said, adding that the Korean people are dynamically struggling to win the final victory of the revolution while overcoming difficulties in their way under the banner of the Juche idea.

articles.title: Meeting of Officials and Secretaries of AKJPR Held in Japan
articles.content:
Meeting of Officials and Secretaries of AKJPR Held in Japan
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- A meeting of officials and secretaries of the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification (AKJPR) took place in Tokyo on May 18.
					 Ri Tong Je, chairman of the AKJPR, in his report at the meeting said that the AKJPR has conducted activities exposing and denouncing the thrice-cursed provocations by the puppet group of traitors of south Korea while positively joining the nationwide movement for reunification, upholding the slogan "Let all Koreans open a gate to national reunification full of new faith!"
					
					 He renewed his will to put an end to the moves to escalate confrontation with fellow countrymen by the puppet group, chieftain of bedeviling the north-south relations, strengthen the solidarity and unity among the north and the south and overseas and national unity of Koreans in Japan and intensify the movement for reunification by decisively enhancing the function and role of the organization.
					
					 He expressed belief that the cause of the Korean nation for reunification is sure to win victory as it is led by the dear respected Kim Jong Un, lodestar of national reunification.
					
					 Then, speeches were made by representatives of officials and secretaries of the AKJPR.

articles.title: Pomminryon Calls for United Struggle for Independent Reunification
articles.content:
Pomminryon Calls for United Struggle for Independent Reunification
						
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) issued a statement on May 18 under the title "Let's carve out the way of independent reunification by unity and struggle".
					 It said they marked the 32nd anniversary of the Kwangju Popular Uprising that took place in protest against the military fascist dictatorship of Chun Doo Hwan, a matchless homicide.
					
					 The uprising set off strong aspiration for independence against U.S. in south Korea and aroused the people to fight against dictatorship, the statement said, adding:
					
					 The just fight has developed into candlelight actions by millions of people today in denunciation of the Lee Myung Bak dictatorship regime that runs counter to the June 15 era of reunification.
					
					 The present situation requires united struggle.
					
					 The South Headquarters of Pomminryon will make every possible effort to end the Lee Myung Bak's dictatorship rule and glorify the June 15 era of reunification by inheriting the spirit displayed by the martyrs of the May 18 Popular Uprising.

articles.title: S. Korean Prosecution's Search of UPP Rebuffed by Its Members
articles.content:
S. Korean Prosecution's Search of UPP Rebuffed by Its Members
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet Seoul District Prosecutor's Office searched the Unified Progressive Party (UPP) on May 21, south Korean KBS and CBS reported.
					 Prosecutors stormed the party building and confiscated all data including server and the list of party members citing "suspicious" fraud-marred election of proportional-representation lawmakers.  The search went on till the dawn the following day.
					
					 When the party side strongly protested the search, the prosecution authorities set in motion more than 400 policemen, creating a terror-ridden atmosphere.
					
					 Meanwhile, the puppet Supreme Prosecutor's Office blustered that it would make an overall investigation into the party, saying that the party has reached the state that can no longer be left as it is.
					
					 Enraged by this, the party members strongly protested the prosecution's reckless search outside the party building.
					
					 They also protested against the search outside the puppet Supreme Prosecutor's Office on May 22.
					
					 They branded the prosecution's confiscation of the party's internal documents as an explicit politically-motivated suppression.
					
					 Calling the prosecution's recent search and confiscation a plot to turn the political situation in favor of the "Saenuri Party" ahead of the "presidential election", they strongly demanded an immediate stop to the politically-motivated suppression of the opposition party.
					
					 The prosecution authorities threatened to walk away all the protestors, terming their protest an "organized one".

articles.title: South Koreans Call for Inheriting Spirit of Kwangju Popular Uprising
articles.content:
South Koreans Call for Inheriting Spirit of Kwangju Popular Uprising
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- A memorial service for participants in the Kwangju Popular Uprising who were cruelly killed by U.S. imperialists and Chun Doo Hwan's military fascist dictators took place in Kwangju of south Korea on Sunday.
					 Present there were the Solidarity for Social Progress, the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, the Confederation of Trade Unions, the Federation of Peasants Associations and other civic and public organizations in south Korea. 
					
					 Speakers at the meeting said 32 years have passed since the uprising but the desire of its participants for independence, democracy and reunification has not come true.
					
					 They accused the present "government" of having suspended its exchange and cooperation with the DPRK under the pretext of the "Cheonan" warship case, ceaselessly staging DPRK-targeted war maneuvers and rendering the situation extremely tense.
					
					 To pool the efforts of the Koreans under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration means inheriting the spirit of Kwangju, they said, calling for carrying on the vigorous actions till a society for people is built under the uplifted banner of independence, peace and great national unity.

articles.title: S. Korean Christian Organizations Protest against Conservative Media's Misinformation
articles.content:
S. Korean Christian Organizations Protest against Conservative Media's Misinformation 
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Christian organizations in Kwangju area of south Korea on May 21 held a press conference to condemn conservative media's misinformation.
					 Speakers at the press conference accused Dong-A Ilbo of hurling all sorts of slanders and calumnies at Late Spring Mun Ik Hwan School in Kangjin County, South Jolla Province some time ago. It blamed the school for the fact that a congratulatory message from the north was read out at its first graduation ceremony and students of the school took part in an action against the import of American beef and the construction of the naval base on Jeju Island and May Day meeting. 
					
					 The paper went the lengths of releasing a grossly distorted report that there is a former long-term prisoner who served a prison term on the charge of espionage among the teachers of the school and there are among parents of the students a culprit of the Wangjaesan incident and the co-representative of the Solidarity for Progress now on trial on the charge of violation of the "security law". 
					
					 The speakers declared that this kind of tailored story written according to information provided by someone without verifying truth is a typical false and biased report of conservative media. 
					
					 On May 19 parents of students of the school in a statement declared they would not remain passive onlookers to this false report of Dong-A Ilbo as it is a manifestation of merciless violence against children's seat of learning.
					
					 The statement urged the paper to make an apology for the distorted report and release a correction.

articles.title: S. Korean Ultra-right Conservatives and Media's Argument about "Following North" Ridiculed
articles.content:
S. Korean Ultra-right Conservatives and Media's Argument about "Following North" Ridiculed 
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Ro Kil Nam, representative of Minjok Thongsin, an internet paper for Koreans in the U.S., in an article "Argument about 'following north' is a comedy in the 21st century" said as follows:
					The ultra-right conservative party and media are deliberately arguing about "following the north" over the internal affairs of the progressive political parties in south Korea these days. This is the most cynical comedy among comedies.
					
					 Media of south Korea are kicking up much fuss about the issue, painting a superficial picture of the situation with its essence and contents deleted.
					
					This has only made a target of a scoff by the overseas compatriots who are sound in mind.
					
					The Lee Myung Bak "government" and the "Saenuri Party" have illegally cracked down upon the Unified Progressive Party by mobilizing the prosecution and police, not content with their smear campaign against the party through a coloring operation. This is one of the comedies, too in the 21st century.
					
					 If the words "following the north" mean reconciliation and cooperation between the south and the north of Korea and mutual help, how nice these words are!
					
					 The above-said words much touted by the conservative media and politicians reflect the Cold War consciousness and reveal the consciousness of anti-communist confrontation.
					
					 It is a mean lever for eliminating their political opponent.
					
					 Do such media arguing about the above-said words have the qualification to talk about freedom, democracy, human rights and social justice.
					
					 Those politicians and media persons who like to use such words are most probably those guys who are not free from treacherous, undemocratic, anti-peace and anti-reunification way of thinking. 
					
					The Lee "government" and the "Saenuri Party" are typical of such political forces.
					
					 The Democratic United Party and the Unified Progressive Party should not join in such argument kicked off by the ultra-right political camp but seek a way of winning victory through solidarity among opposition parties as early as possible.

articles.title: DPRK Launches Countrywide Spring-season Drive for Land Management
articles.content:
DPRK Launches Countrywide Spring-season Drive for Land Management
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea has launched a countrywide spring-season drive for land management.
					 The drive includes tree-planting, technical updating of roads, river improvement, and construction and repairing of apartment buildings and sewage treatment plants.
					
					 The capital city of Pyongyang stands in the van of the drive. Streets in Central, Taedonggang, Mangyongdae and Raknang districts have been face-lifted with various species of trees including Pinus strobus planted, more flower beds made and flowerpot stands set up.
					
					 Phihyon County, North Phyongan Province finished embanking all medium-sized rivers in the county. 
					
					 South Hwanghae Province channeled efforts to restore farmlands and clean out a waterway in Yonbaek Plain. Songhwa County in the province is stepping up the construction and repairing of dwelling houses as well as building of sewage network and sewage purifying sites.
					
					 The drive gains momentum in North Hwanghae, South Hamgyong and Kangwon provinces.
					
					 Over two millions of saplings were planted in Koksan County and fire-arresting lines extending tens of kilometers built in forests around the scenic spot in Mt. Paekun in Yonggwang County. Wonsan City is pressing ahead with the construction of a large-sized tree nursery.
					
					 North Hamgyong Province is considered to be a countrywide frontrunner in managing roads.
					
					 Every year the DPRK sets spring and autumn seasons as periods of general mobilization for land management.

articles.title: Anti-NATO Protests Go on in Chicago
articles.content:
Anti-NATO Protests Go on in Chicago
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Anti-NATO protests go on in Chicago, U.S. 
					 Thousands of anti-NATO protesters marched through downtown Chicago on May 20. 
					
					 Chanting slogans "NATO, NATO, Get Away!" they carried banners or placards bearing such slogans as "No More Wars for US," "No to NATO War," "Stop Drone Attacks" and "NO NATO War Makers." 
					
					 Police helicopters were roaring overhead to monitor the march through downtown Chicago. Seven people have been arrested by police officers.

articles.title: S. Korean Prosecution Accused of Search Operation against Building of UPP
articles.content:
S. Korean Prosecution Accused of Search Operation against Building of UPP
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The south Korean prosecution authorities conducted a search operation against the building of the Unified Progressive Party (UPP), an opposition party, on May 21 under the pretext of clarifying the suspected fraud during the "National Assembly" election.
					 On the morning of that day 48 investigators of the Seoul District Prosecutor's Office and hundreds of policemen stormed the party building and searched three places including the server management office and the body which managed the election. 
					
					 The UPP held a press conference outside the puppet Supreme Prosecutor's Office on May 22 in protest against the fascist prosecution's reckless action.
					
					 Speakers at the press conference vehemently condemned the above-said search operation as unprecedented violence in the history of the constitutional government as it trampled down upon the basic rights to political activities of parties. 
					
					 The prosecution's forcible confiscation of the list of party members, in particular, was explicit politically-motivated suppression and a revelation of the sinister intention to shake the foundation of the progressive party, they stressed.
					
					 Intolerable is the prosecution's search operation, they stated,  noting that this was a plot to split the opposition camp at any cost and eliminate the UPP by labeling it unjust group ahead of the "presidential election".

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Are Great: Editor-in-Chief of Vietnamese Paper
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Are Great: Editor-in-Chief of Vietnamese Paper
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung was born at a simple thatched house but the undying feats he performed for mankind are great. 
					 Head of the delegation of the Vietnamese paper Nhan Dan Thuan Huu, editor-in-chief of the paper, said this after visiting the President's birthplace at Mangyongdae.
					
					 The head said Mangyongdae is a time-honored place and he could not repress astonishment seeing historic relics preserved at the simple old home.

articles.title: Work Introduced Abroad
articles.content:
Work Introduced Abroad
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The detailed contents of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "On Effecting a Drastic Turn in Land Management to Meet the Requirements for Building a Thriving Socialist Nation" was carried by the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy in its bulletin on May 16.
					 The work, published on April 27, 2012, deals with the undying feats President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il performed in the land management and clarifies the general orientation and tasks for sprucing up the country's land as befitting that of a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 The Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea posted the detailed contents of the work on its Internet website on May 15.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Mongolian paper Montsame Medee carried the gist of the work on May 17.

articles.title: Bosnia-Herzegovina Wishes for Boosted Friendly Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Bosnia-Herzegovina Wishes for Boosted Friendly Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- I wish the Korean people big successes in their work for the prosperity of the country under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by the dear respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					 The president of the Presidency of Bosnia-Herzegovina said this when receiving the credentials from DPRK ambassador to his country Kim Son Gyong on May 15. The president expressed his stand to boost the friendly and cooperative relations with the DPRK in different fields.

articles.title: Invincible Power of DPRK Praised by Foreign Figure
articles.content:
Invincible Power of DPRK Praised by Foreign Figure
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held in Paris on May 15 to hear the report of the delegation of the France-Korea Friendship Association about its visit to the DPRK. The delegation participated in the celebrations of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Present there were the president and the members of the Association. The staff members of the DPRK mission in Paris were present on invitation.
					
					 Benua Kenedei, vice-president of the Association, said he took part in the celebrations of the centenary of Kim Il Sung's birth and was honored to see the dear respected supreme leader Kim Jong Un and hear his speech.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 At the 4th Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea and the fifth session of the 12th Supreme People's Assembly leader Kim Jong Il was held in high esteem as eternal general secretary of the WPK and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and Kim Jong Un was elected first secretary of the WPK and first chairman of the NDC. The statues of the peerlessly great men were magnificently built on Mansu Hill in Pyongyang.
					
					 All the celebrations including the April Spring Friendship Art Festival, evening of fireworks and the evening gala of the youth and students were held on a high level.
					
					 During the visit I could deeply feel again the Korean people's boundless reverence for Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, their indomitable will to carry forward to the end the cause of the preceding leaders rallied close around Kim Jong Un and the invincible might of the DPRK.
					
					 We will more actively conduct solidarity activities in the future to support the Korean people's just cause for national reunification and building a thriving nation.

articles.title: Premier recorre campo de reconstruccion de universidad
articles.content:
Premier recorre campo de reconstruccion de universidad
 Pyongyang, 24 de mayo (ACNC) -- El premier Choe Yong Rim, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC, averiguo en el terreno el dia 24 el estado de la reconstruccion de la Universidad Pedagogica Kim Hyong Jik en etapa final.
					 Segun el noble proposito de generaciones venideras del Dirigente Kim Jong Il y a las ordenes del Comandante Supremo Kim Jong Un, los constructores militares cumplieron en un corto plazo inmensas tareas acelerando la velocidad de ejecucion y renovando la figura del plantel docente.
					
					 Choe recorrio el mural mosaico con imagenes del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il erguido en el recinto de la universidad, nuevos edificios y otros puntos.
					
					 En la reunion consultiva, se abordaron los problemas tales como asegurar el caracter plastico y artistico de la arquitectura al aprender el temperamento de lucha y modo de creacion de los constructores militares y terminar cualitativamente la instalacion de equipos docentes y otros quehaceres detallados.
					
					 Se tomaron las medidas para acondicionar mejor la universidad, centro de formacion de educadores donde estan impregnadas las hazanas de orientacion de los grandes hombres del monte Paektu, y para hacer que las unidades vinculadas suministren suficientemente los materiales necesarios.

articles.title: Kim Ki Nam se reune con Thuan Huu
articles.content:
Kim Ki Nam se reune con Thuan Huu
 Pyongyang, 24 de mayo (ACNC) -- El secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea Kim Ki Nam se reunio el dia 24 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la delegacion del periodico vietnamita Nhan Dan encabezada por el editor en jefe Thuan Huu.
					 En la ocasion el jefe de la delegacion vietnamita dijo que a traves de la visita a Corea llego a  conocer bien los exitos logrados por el pueblo coreano en la lucha por construir el socialismo y realizar la causa de la reunificacion de la patria bajo la direccion del Presidente Kim Il Sung, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il y el Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Subrayo que el pueblo coreano es el heroico que no se doblega ante cualquier aplastamiento de las fuerzas extranjeras.
					
					 Expreso la voluntad de contribuir a desarrollar mas el intercambio y la cooperacion entre los dos organos del partido.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al rey de Jordania
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al rey de Jordania 
 Pyongyang, 24 de mayo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 24 un mensaje al rey del Reino Hachemita de Jordania, Abdullah II, para felicitarle por el 66o aniversario de la independencia de ese pais. 
					 El remitente deseo buena salud y felicidad al monarca y formulo votos por el incesante desarrollo y prosperidad de Jordania amistosa.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun se reune con nuevos embajadores extranjeros
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun se reune con nuevos embajadores extranjeros
 Pyongyang, 24 de mayo (ACNC) -- El canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun departio el dia 24 por separado con Manibadrakh Ganbold y Roberto Colin, nuevos embajadores de Mongolia y Brasil en Corea, que le hicieron la visita de cortesia.
